details.flavorText: Little more than a coiled mass of intestines encircling a massive gaping maw, this qlippoth is an Abyssal scavenger, subsisting on the filth and leftovers of demons and qlippoth alike, although it relishes any opportunity to consume living prey. Despite this seeming lowly role in the Abyssal ecosystem, a nyogoth is far from a stupid beast and can orchestrate cunning ambushes to secure its next meal.

description.value:
You conjure a poisonous fog. This functions as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Obscuring Mist]{Obscuring Mist}, except the area moves 10 feet away from you each round. You deal 6d8 poison damage to each breathing creature that starts its turn in the spell's area. You can Dismiss the spell.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

You conjure an arrow of acid that continues corroding the target after it hits. Make a spell attack against the target. On a hit, you deal 3d8 acid damage plus 1d6 persistent acid damage. On a critical hit, double the initial damage, but not the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Damage}.

Heightened (+2) The initial damage increases by 2d8, and the persistent acid damage increases by 1d6.

Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.

You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened 3} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Fleeing]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to five creatures.

A monster with darkvision can see perfectly well in areas of darkness and dim light, though such vision is in black and white only. Some forms of magical darkness, such as a 4th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Darkness]{Darkness} spell, block normal darkvision. A monster with @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Greater Darkvision]{Greater Darkvision}, however, can see through even these forms of magical darkness.

A monster with telepathy can communicate mentally with any creatures within the listed radius, as long as they share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts, and communicates no more information than normal speech would.
The monster can cast its at-will spells any number of times without using up spell slots.

Trigger The nyogoth takes piercing or slashing damage;

Effect The nyogoth sprays its acidic blood on adjacent creatures, dealing [[/r 6d6 #acid]] acid damage (basic Reflex save).

Requirement The nyogoth has @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Grabbed]{Grabbed} a creature;

Effect The nyogoth slavers and chews at the grabbed creature, dealing [[/r 2d6+7 #slashing]] slashing and [[/r 1d6 #acid]] acid damage (basic Fortitude save).

The nyogoth untangles its tentacles and prolapses its many mouths, turning itself inside out in a truly nauseating display. Creatures in a 30-foot emanation must attempt a Will save, after which they are temporarily immune to further Nauseating Displays for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stunned]{Stunned 3} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stunned]{Stunned 5} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened 2}.

Requirements The monster's last action was a success with a Strike that lists Grab in its damage entry, or it has a creature grabbed using this action.

Effect The monster automatically Grabs the target until the end of the monster's next turn. The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Grabbed]{Grabbed} by whichever body part the monster attacked with, and that body part can't be used to Strike creatures until the grab is ended. Using Grab extends the duration of the monster's Grab until the end of its next turn for all creatures grabbed by it. A grabbed creature can use the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Escape]{Escape} action to get out of the grab, and the Grab ends for a grabbed creatures if the monster moves away from it.
